titles.ar: بَابُ فَضْلِ الرُّجُوعِ إِلَى الْمَدِينَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 215 – The merits of the returning to Al-Medina (after performing Hajj)

titles.ar: بَابُ فَضْلِ الرُّجُوعِ إِلَى الْمَدِينَةِ
titles.en: Chapter 215 – The merits of the returning to Al-Medina (after performing Hajj)

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/259)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ الْمُثَنَّى عَنْ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ ابْدَءُوا بِمَكَّةَ وَ اخْتِمُوا بِنَا .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Al Musna, from Sadeyr,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Begin with Makkah and end with us<sup>asws</sup> (at Al-Medina)’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from Hisham ibn af-Muthanna’ from Sadir who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that you should commence with Makkah and end with us.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (8/259)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَبْدَأُ بِالْمَدِينَةِ أَوْ بِمَكَّةَ قَالَ ابْدَأْ بِمَكَّةَ وَ اخْتِمْ بِالْمَدِينَةِ فَإِنَّهُ أَفْضَلُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Abdullah, from Ahmad Bin Abu Abdullah, from his father who said,
‘I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Shall I begin with Al-Medina or with Makkah?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Begin with Makkah and end with Al-Medina, for it is superior’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Muhammad ibn ‘Abd Allah has narrated from Ahmad ibn abu ‘Abd Allah from his father who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, ’Should I commence with al-Madinah or Makkah?’ He (the Imam) replied, ’Commence with Makkah and end with al-Madinah; it is more virtuous.’”
